intro: Spiladocorys, commonly known as the red-tailed orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its striking red or orange-tipped petals and a distinctive, elongated flower structure. Native to tropical regions of South America, these plants thrive in humid, shaded environments. Spiladocorys species typically have long, slender stems and are often found growing epiphytically on trees. Their flowers are pollinated by specific insect species, contributing to their ecological significance in their native habitats.
